titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Murrysville Garden Club Records, 1952-2016 AIS.2016.05
titlestmt.author: Thaddeus J. Kotarski, III and Genevieve Girvan.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 10:08:05 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

physdesc.extent: (9 records center boxes, 2 document cases, and 1 oversized folder)

did.abstract: This collection documents the function and activities of the Murrysville Garden Club (MGC) from 1952 to 2016. Included are organization yearbooks, meeting minutes, financial and committee reports, newsletters, awards, project records, clippings related to the MGC, the records of the Murrysville Junior Garden Club Earth Team, correspondence, photographs, and audio-visual materials.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Murrysville Garden Club on September 8, 2016.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series IX. Junior Garden Club Earth Team

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: The Murrysville Garden Club (MGC) was founded on March 26, 1952 by Anna Cotter. Cotter, a 1951 Pennsylvania State University graduate with a degree in Agriculture, served as the MGC's inaugural president from 1952-1953. The MGC Creed, which first appeared in the organization's 1953 yearbook, describes the Club's purpose as being twofold. First, it stated that the Club existed to promote the idea that humanity had an obligation to preserve nature. Second, it expressed the belief that gardening could enrich members' lives through its unique social, environmental, and personal experiences. In its first year, the MGC totaled sixty-three members. By 1960, this number had expanded to ninety-nine. Since 1975, membership has ranged between fifty and a hundred members, averaging around between sixty and seventy members annually.

The MGC's commitment to particpating in events in Murrysville locally and Westmoreland County regionally expanded between 1970 and 1990. The MGC had had a youth outreach program through the late 1950s and 1960s, but this endeavor was much less central to the MGC's overall mission than the one that was born when the organization increased youth activites in the 1970s and 1980s. It was during this time that the MGC Junior Garden Earth Science Club (called the MGC Junior Garden Club Earth Team after 1999) was founded to teach children the values of the environmental movement.

The 1980s through the 2000s saw a large expansion in the MGC's participation in regional and state garden club competitions. In this period, the MGC began applying for (and winning) a large number of awards from the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania (GCFP), National Council of State Garden Clubs (NCSGC), and National Garden Clubs Incorporated (NGC). The MGC was and remains very active in its membership of the GCFP especially.

Annually, the MGC organizes a sizeable number of community events, including annual garden tours, "May Mart" sales to raise money, Christmas wreath making sessions and holiday sales to raise money but also to make affordable Christmas decorations for the community, and Arbor Day and Earth Day celebrations to promote environmentalism. The MGC organizes "garden therapy" sessions at local nursing homes designed to engage older members of the community, educate citizens about gardening, and promote the therapeutic effects of gardening espoused in the MGC Creed. Frequently, these events are attended by children and members of the MGC Junior Garden Club with the intention of promoting civic awareness. Community projects the MGC has organized include a Route 22 beautification effort to clean up the local roadway and maintenance work at the local federal post office and war memorials.

As part of its mission to promote environmental awareness, the MGC awards college scholarships to those studying fields related to gardening - such as biology, agronomy, and landscaping - and the Business Beautification Award to Murrysville businesses that take steps to maintain their properties in appealing and civically responsible ways.

The MGC is a member of several larger regional and national organizations. As of 2017, these include the National Garden Clubs Incorporated (NGC); the National Council of State Garden Clubs (NCSGC); the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania, District VII (GCFP); the Audubon Society of Western Pennsylvania; the Westmoreland Conservancy; and the Pennsylvania Cleanways organization. Additionally, the MGC has historically tried to keep in contact with the Greensburg Garden Club, another Westmoreland County organization.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Murrysville Garden Club Records, AIS.2016.05, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Thaddeus J. Kotarski III from June-August 2017. Additions processed and integrated by Genevieve Girvan, February 2018.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Garden Club of Allegheny County Records, 1913-2012, AIS.2006.07, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Murrysville Garden Club Records are composed of a wide variety of record types, including club minutes, official awards given to and distributed by the MGC, bank and financial statements, photographs, scrapbooks, project files, and ephemera. The MGC is a member of the GCFP (District VII), NCSGC, and NGC. These affiliations compose a significant part of the MGC's history and are well-documented in the collection.

controlaccess.subject: Environmental quality -- Pennsylvania -- Westmoreland County
Gardening -- Pennsylvania -- Murrysville -- Societies, etc.
Gardening -- Pennsylvania -- Westmoreland County -- Societies, etc.
Environmental quality -- Pennsylvania -- Murrysville

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the annual yearbooks of the MGC from 1952, the year of its founding, to 2014. The yearbooks of the MGC typically list current club officers, awards won in the past year, past presidents, a membership directory, the Club Creed, a theme for the year, and an overview of ongoing projects. The yearbooks frequently list national and regional affiliations to organizations like the GCFP and NCSGC. Not present in collection are the yearbooks from 1954-1955, 1957, 1964, 1965, 1980, 2009, and 2012-2013. The folders are organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of the proceedings of the meetings of the MGC Executive Board, MGC General Membership, and GCFP Annual Convention. The material in this collection dates from 1963 to 2011. This series is broken into four subseries.

did.unittitle: Executive Board and General Membership Meeting Combined

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is composed of the annual proceedings of the MGC Executive Board and General Membership. These records have been sorted separately from subseries two and three because in these, unlike the documents which compose those series, the authors deliberately preserved the minutes of the Executive Board and General Membership meetings together. In many cases, Executive Board and General Membership meeting records appear on the same page or have been pasted and/or stapled together. This material dates from 1963 to 1989. The years 1970-1979 and 1981-1984 are not included. The folders are organized chronologically. In cases where there is overlap in years covered with other folders, folders have been sorted by the first year mentioned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries records the proceedings of the meetings of the Executive Board of the MGC. The Executive Board traditionally meets at least once a month, but sometimes meets twice if there is need. Additionally, the Board typically meets for more months out of the year than the General Membership does, meeting during the winter months of the year to plan while the rest of the membership takes time off. The minutes of the Executive Board are composed by the Recording Secretary. This material ranges from 1970 to 2010, with the years 1985 and 1986 not included. The folders are organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the proceedings of the General Membership meetings of the MGC. While there has historically been some variation, General Membership meetings are typically held once a month from January or February through November. General Membership meetings are open to the entirety of the Club body and typically consist of officers making reports in turn. As with Executive Board minutes, those of the General Membership meeting are composed by the Recording Secretary. The material ranges from 1970 to 2010, with the years 1984-1988 not included. The folders are organized chronologically.

did.unittitle: Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania Annual Convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is composed of the minutes of the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania's (GCFP) annual meetings. The yearly meeting brings together delegates from regional member organizations such as the Murrsyville Garden Club. The GCFP Annual Convention recognizes the accomplishments of individual clubs and their members, considers motions changing the rules of the organization, and offers a variety of activities related to gardening and Pennsylvania heritage for delegates. The minutes of the GCFP Annual Convention are publicly published. The material in this subseries ranges from 2006-2011, with the years 2009-2010 not included. The folders are organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of the financial records of the MGC, including revenue and expense reports, budgets and proposed budgets, and official bank statements. The material dates from 1962-2012. The folders are organized alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Budget of the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the reports of committees and committee chairmen to the MGC president. Reports are typically collected annually and summarize actions taken in the previous year. The material dates from 1954-2013. The folders are organized aphabetically first and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: Civic and Conservation Committee Annual Reports
Greensburg Garden Club Representative Job Description
Greensburg Garden Club Representative Annual Reports
National Council of State Garden Clubs Guide for New Officers and Committees
Needs and Concerns Committee Annual Reports
Telephone and Transportation Committee Chairman Job Description
Telephone and Transportation Committee Annual Reports
Treasurer and Assistant Treasurer Job Descriptions
Ways and Means Committee Job Description
Ways and Means Committee Annual Reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of the newsletters of the MGC. Club newsletters are compiled monthly and mailed to members. Newsletters are not published publicly and serve as internal updates of the Club's activity. The newsletters are typically produced from February or March through November and consist of a letter from the Club president, a schedule, a concerns and well-wishes section, a recipe-of-the-month, and any pertinent committee or project updates that concern the entire membership. The material dates from 1970-2013, with the years 1979, 1980-1981, 1983, and 2012 not included. The folders are organized chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series includes all awards, honors, certificates, and citations given to the MGC. The series also includes all awards and scholarships given by the Club to other parties. It is broken into two subseries. The material dates from 1972-2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of all awards and forms of recognition that have been given to the MGC. The vast majority of these records are awards given to the Club by the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania (GCFP), National Council of State Garden Clubs (NCSGC), and National Garden Clubs Incorporated (NGC). The material is composed of scrapbooks, award applications, offical awards, and ephemera, such as wooden plaques and ribbons. Also included is oversized signage related to awards in the subseries. The material dates from 1975-2012. The folders are organized alphabetically and then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of awards and scholarships given by the MGC to other entities. Included in this section are the student scholarships which the Club offers to college students studying areas related to gardening and the Business Beautification Award for Murrysville businesses which maintain their properties in an appealing way. The records in this section are comprised of scrapbooks, official awards, and award applications. The material dates from 1972-2014. The folders are organized thematically.

did.unittitle: Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania Financial Aid and Scholarships
Valerie and Dottie Award for Service to the Garden Club
Murrysville Garden Club and Franklin Regional School District Martha Miller Hummingbird Award
Murrysville Garden Club, National Council of State Garden Clubs, and Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania Speech and Essay Contests
National Council of State Garden Clubs Financial Aid and Scholarships

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of all material related to projects, events, and activities organized by the MGC. A substantial part of the records relate to the MGC's Christmas Workshop, Flower Shows, and Garden Tours. The records consist of both scrapbooks and individual items within folders. The material dates from 1952-2015. The folders are organized alphabetically and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: Flower Show Handbook (National Garden Club, inc.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of newspaper and magazine clippings collected by the Club. These include stories covering MGC and Junior Garden Club events and the "Green Thumb" column published by members of the Club. The material dates from 1959-2016. The folders are organized alphabetically and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: Green Thumb Newspaper Column and Related Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series collates the records of the Murrysville Junior Garden Club Earth Team. The Junior Garden Club Earth Team is open to Murrysville area elementary and middle school students and is sponsored by the MGC. The purpose of the Team is to teach the community's youth the value of environmentalism. The series is composed of four subseries. The material dates from 1968-2012.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries is composed of the yearbooks of the Junior Garden Club Earth Team. Like the yearbooks of the MGC, those of the Junior Garden Club Earth Team typically include an overview of activities undertaken in the past year, a list of officers, a list of awards won in the past year, and updates on ongoing projects. The material in this subseries has substantial gaps and includes only the years 1968, 1972, and 1985. The folders are organized chronologically.

did.unittitle: Junior Garden Club Committee Reports and Financial Records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of the financial records, annual reports, and committee descriptions of the Junior Garden Club Earth Team. These records detail the income and expenditure of the Team, summaries of projects, and the activity and membership of the Team's governing committees. The material dates from 1987-2012, with the years 1994-1995 not included. The folders are organized thematically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of summaries of the Junior Garden Club Earth Team's projects in the community. The material dates from 2001-2005. The folders are organized alphabetically and then chronologically.

did.unittitle: Today's Youth Plant Tomorrow's Trees Project
Today's Youth Plant Tomorrow's Trees Project
Awards Won by the Junior Garden Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries collates all of the awards and forms of recognition given to the Junior Garden Club Earth Team. The bulk of the material consists of awards given to the Team by the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania (GCFP), National Council of State Garden Clubs (NCSGC), and National Garden Clubs Incorporated (NGC). The records include scrapbooks, official awards, and award applications. The material dates from 1975-2011. The folders are organized alphabetically and the chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of all correspondence (letters, postcards, emails, greeting cards, etc.) in the records of the Club that were not preserved with other documents. The material dates from 1988-2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series consists of all photographs in the collection not included in scrapbooks. There is a significant variety in the format of material in the series, including standard photographic negatives, slide negatives, Polaroids, and varying sizes of normal photographs. The material dates from 1952-2016. The folders are organized alphabetically and then chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of all audio-visual material in the collection. The records consist of VHS tapes and computer disks. The VHS tapes were originally used in awards applications. The computer disk contains soley audio, whereas the VHS tapes have moving image data. Most of the material is undated, but the computer disk is dated as a copy of a 1975 interview on tape. The items are organized by medium, with VHS tapes first followed by CDs second.

did.unittitle: Murraysville Garden Club, "Video of Christmas Tour, Tea and Bazaar," [24.5 minutes]
Anna Cotter Interviewed by Jeanne Daly, [19.59 minutes]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed four scrapbooks, which contain materials documenting Murrysville Garden Club activities from 1957-1997. The materials included in the scrapbooks are yearbooks, awards, flyers, prize ribbons, newspaper clippings, letters, programs, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series is composed of materials relating to the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania. The series includes a folder of plans and correspondence concerning the Governor's Residence Preservation Project in 2001 as well as two news booklets. One of these news booklets is a special edition for the 50th anniversary of the Garden Club Federation of Pennsylvania.
